meta.title: Digg - What the Internet is talking about right now

div.a: How The Attack That Killed America's Ambassador Really Happened

div.div: A long night of mayhem in which the U.S. consulate was overrun and torched, the ambassador lost and dying alone in the smoke while rescuers ran into a deadly ambush as they sought to save survivors, seemed to overwhelm U.S. security procedures.

li.div: Excellent, detailed, devastating report by Reuters on exactly what happened at the Libyan embassy. reuters.com/article/2012/0...

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Pkh64a&via=Digg&text=How The Attack That Killed America's Ambassador Really Happened

div.a: How Many Degrees Separate Kevin Bacon From Helen Keller?

div.div: Google debuted a new search tool today. Type “Bacon number” into the search bar with any celebrity's name and say goodbye to your afternoon.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TPs3R8&via=Digg&text=How Many Degrees Separate Kevin Bacon From Helen Keller?

div.a: Ex Porn Stars Are The 99 Percent

div.div: The most heartbreaking scene in the documentary After Porn Ends, about the post-porn lives of 12 adult stars, may be when Asia Carrera talks about her membership in the high-IQ society Mensa.

div.a: How To Really Understand Pink Floyd

div.div: "Allow me to explain why they're worth the trouble of disassociating the name Pink Floyd from the dummy in your dorm who wouldn’t shut up about how deep The Wall was."

li.div: If you’ve come this far thinking Pink Floyd is hippie garbage, @scharpling is here to show you the error of your ways: buzzfeed.com/scharpling/ho...

div.div: Guatemala's head of emergency evacuations says more than 33,000 people are fleeing the eruption of a long-active volcano just outside one of the country's most famous tourist attractions.

div.a: The World's Oldest Color Film Discovered

div.div: The National Media Museum has found what it contends are truly historic films from 1901/02, pre-dating what had been thought to be the first successful color process – Kinemacolor – by eight years.

div.a: Electronics Baked In Bread Actually Work

div.div: Debbi Nitzan, a masters student in industrial design at Bezalel Academy of Arts and Design in Jerusalem has found inspiration in these pairs of opposites to create a truly organic product.

div.a: Does The Internet Make You Dumb?

div.div: Dr. Manfred Spitzer, a top German neuroscientist, argues that teaching young kids finger-counting games is much better for them than letting them explore on a laptop.

div.a: The Creepiest Spider Videos You’ll Ever See

div.div: If you’re even slightly arachnophobic, stop reading right now.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RJl63i&via=Digg&text=The Creepiest Spider Videos You’ll Ever See

div.a: A Gun Battle Fought With... Chalk

div.div: This supernova from the 17th century shined more brilliantly than Jupiter and remained visible – even during the day – over several weeks.

li.div: Really mind blowing. RT "@universetoday: The Unusually Colossal Kepler Supernova universetoday.com/97314/th...

div.div: This week, Roth published an incensed, long and slightly broad “open letter” to Wikipedia on the website of The New Yorker. The letter laid bare the ways that the icons of old media and the icons of new media fail to understand one another.

div.a: The Best Driver In The Galaxy

div.div: George Takei on his family's internment, playing Sulu, and William Shatner's gaydar fail.
A virulently anti-Islam movie trailer sparked widespread protests across the Arab world and may have caused the death of a U.S. ambassador. But the truth about Islam is anything but hateful.

div.a: The School That Swapped Its Laptops For iPads... And Wants To Switch Back

div.div: There have been several well-publicised stories of schools bringing iPads into the classroom. However, a PC Pro reader has got in touch with a cautionary tale from the other side of the fence.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RPPc40&via=Digg&text=The School That Swapped Its Laptops For iPads... And Wants To Switch Back

div.a: World's Tallest Dog And Cat Discovered

div.div: The great dane, Zeus, towers 7 feet 4 inches above his owner when he stands on his hind legs.

div.a: James Cameron Proves That Jack Had To Die

div.div: In an interview, James Cameron crushes the hopes of teenage girls from the 90s once and for all.

div.a: New Cameras To Watch Cameras That Watch You

div.div: Many people find speed cameras frustrating, and some in the region are taking their rage out on the cameras themselves. But now there's a new solution: cameras to watch the cameras.

div.div: TELL THAT TO AN iPHONE BATTERY
Intel has predicted that the shrinking energy cost of computation will reach a point where the energy require for "meaningful compute" will approach zero.

div.a: Putin Admits Wildlife Stunts Are Staged

div.div: Russian President Vladimir Putin has admitted that some of his most famous media adventures with wildlife have been carefully staged but has said they were worthwhile because they drew the public's attention to important conservation projects.

li.div: No! It's like Santa all over again. RT @Reuters: Vladimir Putin admits wildlife stunts are staged reuters.com/article/2012/0...
